info.description: The XNAT REST API (XAPI) functions provide access to XNAT internal functions for remote clients.
info.title: XNAT REST API

delete.summary: Clears the element cache for the current user=.

200.description: The user's cache was properly cleared.

401.description: Must be authenticated to access the XNAT REST API.

delete.summary: Clears the element cache for the specified user.

parameters.name: username
parameters.description: Indicates the name of the user whose cache should be flushed. If not provided, this flushes the cache of the current user.

200.description: The specified user's cache was properly cleared.

401.description: Must be authenticated to access the XNAT REST API.

403.description: You do not have sufficient permissions to clear the specified user's cache..

get.summary: Returns a map indicating the status of the cache initialization.

200.description: A map with information on the status of cache initialization.

401.description: Must be authenticated to access the XNAT REST API.

403.description: You do not have sufficient permissions to access the list of available element displays.

404.description: Indicates that the cache implementation doesn't have the ability to report its status.

get.summary: Gets a list of the available element displays.
get.description: The available element displays can be used as parameters for this call in the form /xapi/access/displays/{DISPLAY}. This call is accessible to guest users when the site preference require login is set to false (i.e. open XNATs).

200.description: A list of available element displays.

401.description: Must be authenticated to access the XNAT REST API.

403.description: You do not have sufficient permissions to access the list of available element displays.

get.summary: Gets the last modified timestamp for the current user.
get.description: This indicates the time of the latest update to elements relevant to the user. An update to these elements can mean that permissions for the user have changed and the various displays should be refreshed if cached on the client side.

200.description: A list of available element displays.

401.description: Must be authenticated to access the XNAT REST API.

403.description: You do not have sufficient permissions to access the list of available element displays.

get.summary: Gets a list of the element displays of the specified type for the current user.
get.description: This call is accessible to guest users when the site preference require login is set to false (i.e. open XNATs).

200.description: A list of element displays of the specified type for the current user.

401.description: Must be authenticated to access the XNAT REST API.

403.description: You do not have sufficient permissions to access the list of available element displays.

get.summary: Gets the last modified timestamp for the specified user. This can only be called by users with administrative privileges.
get.description: This indicates the time of the latest update to elements relevant to the specified user. An update to these elements can mean that permissions for the specified user have changed and the various displays should be refreshed if cached on the client side.

parameters.name: username
parameters.description: The user to get the last modified timestamp for.

200.description: Timestamp of when the list of available element displays for the specified user was updated.

401.description: Must be authenticated to access the XNAT REST API.

403.description: You do not have sufficient permissions to access the user's cache timestamp.

401.description: Must be authenticated to access the XNAT REST API.

403.description: You do not have sufficient permissions to access the user's projects and roles.

put.summary: Refresh the catalog entry for one or more resources.
put.description: The resource should be identified by standard archive-relative paths, such as /archive/experiments/XNAT_E0001 or /archive/projects/XNAT_01/subjects/XNAT_01_01.

parameters.name: resources
parameters.description: The list of resources to be refreshed.

200.description: The refresh operation(s) were completed successfully.

500.description: An unexpected or unknown error occurred

put.summary: Refresh the catalog entry for one or more resources, performing only the operations specified.
put.description: The resource should be identified by standard archive-relative paths, such as /archive/experiments/XNAT_E0001 or /archive/projects/XNAT_01/subjects/XNAT_01_01. The available operations are All, Append, Checksum, Delete, and PopulateStats. They should be comma separated but without spaces. Omitting the operations implies All.

parameters.name: resources
parameters.description: The list of resources to be refreshed.

200.description: The refresh operation(s) were completed successfully.

500.description: An unexpected or unknown error occurred

post.summary: Creates a download catalog for the submitted sessions and other data objects.
post.description: The map submitted to this call supports lists of object IDs organized by key type: sessions, scan_type, scan_format, recon, assessors, and resources. The response for this method is the ID for the catalog of resolved resources, which can be submitted to the download/{catalog} function to retrieve the catalog or to the download/{catalog}/zip function to retrieve thefiles in the catalog as a zip archive.

200.description: The download catalog was successfully built.

400.description: Something is wrong with the request format.

403.description: The user is not authorized to access one or more of the specified resources.

404.description: The request was valid but one or more of the specified resources was not found.

500.description: An unexpected or unknown error occurred

400.description: Something is wrong with the request format.

500.description: An unexpected or unknown error occurred

post.summary: Creates a download catalog for the submitted sessions and other data objects.
post.description: The map submitted to this call supports lists of object IDs organized by key type: sessions, scan_type, scan_format, recon, assessors, and resources. The response for this method is jsonwith the ID for the catalog of resolved resources (which can be submitted to the download/{catalog} function to retrieve the catalog or to the download/{catalog}/zip functionto retrieve the files in the catalog as a zip archive), as well as the total size of the files.

get.summary: Returns whether internal scripting is enabled for this XNAT application.
get.description: Internal scripting may be used by XNAT itself even when disabled, but this setting indicates whether users and administrators can configure and execute scripts internally to the application process. Access to this setting is restricted to site administrators.

post.summary: Downloads the XNAT log files as a zip archive.
post.description: This call takes a string map as JSON. PUT and POST are the same operation. Acceptable values in the map include: "logFileSpec" is a glob-style  wild card, e.g. '*.log', 'application.*', etc. This defaults to '*'. "path" specifies the path to the folder containing the log files you want to access. The default value is the logs folder in your XNAT home directory, but you can specify other paths to which the XNAT application server user has access, e.g. "/var/log/tomcat" to retrieve the Tomcat logs. The "asZip" parameter indicates whether the log file(s) should be downloaded as a zip. By default, a single file is downloaded as plain text unless asZip is explicitly set to true, while multiple files are always downloaded as a zip. Finally "includeEmptyFiles" indicates whether empty files should be included. By default only files that contain data are included.

401.description: Must be authenticated to access the XNAT REST API.

403.description: The user is not authorized to access one or more of the specified resources.

put.summary: Downloads the XNAT log files as a zip archive.
put.description: This call takes a string map as JSON. PUT and POST are the same operation. Acceptable values in the map include: "logFileSpec" is a glob-style  wild card, e.g. '*.log', 'application.*', etc. This defaults to '*'. "path" specifies the path to the folder containing the log files you want to access. The default value is the logs folder in your XNAT home directory, but you can specify other paths to which the XNAT application server user has access, e.g. "/var/log/tomcat" to retrieve the Tomcat logs. The "asZip" parameter indicates whether the log file(s) should be downloaded as a zip. By default, a single file is downloaded as plain text unless asZip is explicitly set to true, while multiple files are always downloaded as a zip. Finally "includeEmptyFiles" indicates whether empty files should be included. By default only files that contain data are included.

post.summary: Sets the mail service properties. This return the SMTP server configuration as it exists after being set.
post.description: Sets the mail service host, port, username, password, and protocol. You can set extra properties on the mail sender (e.g. for configuring SSL or TLS transport) by specifying the property name and value. Any parameters submitted that are not one of the standard mail sender attributes is set as a mail sender property. You can remove existing properties by setting the property with an empty value. This will override any existing configuration. You can change the values of properties by calling the API method for that specific property or by calling the PUT version of this method.

parameters.description: The value to set for the email host.

parameters.name: password
parameters.description: The value to set for the email password.

parameters.name: port

parameters.name: properties
parameters.description: Values to set for extra mail properties. An empty value indicates that an existing property should be removed.

parameters.description: The value to set for the email protocol.

parameters.name: username
parameters.description: The value to set for the email username.

put.summary: Sets the submitted mail service properties. This returns the SMTP server configuration as it exists after being set.
put.description: Sets the mail service host, port, username, password, and protocol. You can set extra properties on the mail sender (e.g. for configuring SSL or TLS transport) by specifying the property name and value. Any parameters submitted that are not one of the standard mail sender attributes is set as a mail sender property. You can remove existing properties by setting the property with an empty value. This will modify the existing server configuration. You can completely replace the configuration by calling the POST version of this method.

parameters.description: The value to set for the email host.

parameters.name: password
parameters.description: The value to set for the email password.

parameters.name: port
parameters.description: The value to set for the email port.

parameters.name: properties
parameters.description: Values to set for extra mail properties. An empty value indicates that an existing property should be removed.

parameters.name: protocol
parameters.description: The value to set for the email protocol.

parameters.description: The value to set for the email username.

post.description: Returns the ID of the queued request. If the specified ID doesn't exist as a resource survey request, 404 is returned.
